Use the J for service between Myrtle Av and Hewes St. Free shuttle buses provide alternate service between Hewes St and Essex St, stopping at Marcy Av. Transfer between J and M trains at Myrtle Av. Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.

Bicycle permits are required to bring bikes onboard LIRR trains, with the exception of folding bikes. Bike permits can be purchased for $5 at LIRR station ticket windows or onboard trains. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for details on bike restrictions.

Buses Replace Early-morning Ronkonkoma Br. Trains Sun. Aug. 2

On Sun. August 2, from 12:45AM until 8:30AM, buses will replace twelve early-morning trains between Deer Park & Ronkonkoma while trackwork is performed. See http://bit.ly/1Kw83v9 for details. E/B customers will transfer to buses at Deer Park for travel to stations Brentwood, Central Islip & Ronkonkoma. W/B customers at stations Ronkonkoma, Central Islip & Brentwood will board buses, up to 27 mins. earlier than normal, bound for Deer Park, then transfer to trains for points west.
Buses Replace Early-morning Ronkonkoma Br. Trains Sat. Aug. 1

On Sat. August 1, from 12:45AM until 5:30AM, buses will replace six early-morning trains between Hicksville & Ronkonkoma while trackwork is performed. See http://bit.ly/1Kw83v9 for details. E/B customers will transfer to buses at Hicksville for travel to stations Wyandanch thru Ronkonkoma. Bethpage & Farmingdale customers will have regular train service. W/B customers at stations Ronkonkoma thru Wyandanch will board buses to Hicksville, then transfer to trains for points west.

R Line – Weeknight Planned Service Change

10 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Jul 27 –31 No R trains between 95 St and 36 St, Brooklyn. R trains skip Union St, 4 Av-9 St, Prospect Av, and 25 St, in both directions. Use free shuttle buses and D or N trains. Travel alternatives: Evening R service operates between 71 Av, Queens, and 36 St, Brooklyn. Late night R shuttle service is suspended. Free shuttle buses operate between 95 St and 59 St, stopping at 86 St, 77 St, and Bay Ridge Av. D trains run local between DeKalb Av and 36 St. N trains run local between DeKalb Av and 59 St, in Brooklyn. Transfer between free shuttle buses and N trains at 59 St. Transfer between D, N, and R trains at Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr or 36 St.

Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.

Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.
Buses Replace Five Early-Morning Trains Fri. July 24 btwn Great Neck & Pt Washington

On Fri. July 24, buses/vans replace five early-morning trains between Great Neck & Pt. Washington from 12:50 AM to 4:30 AM while trackwork is performed. See http://bit.ly/1IjrDes for details. Port Jervis Line Weekday Off-Peak Busing Between Middletown & Harriman July 22 & 23

Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.

Bicycle permits are required to bring bikes onboard LIRR trains, with the exception of folding bikes. Bike permits can be purchased for $5 at LIRR station ticket windows or onboard trains. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for details on bike restrictions.

LIRR Service for Foo Fighters Concert at Citi Field July 15 & 16

The LIRR is making extra stops to Mets-Willets Point Station to get fans to and from the Foo Fighters Concert at Citi Field today and tomorrow, July 15 & 16. Fans traveling from Long Island on other LIRR branches can reach Citi Field by transferring to a Port Washington train at Woodside. Buy round-trip tickets in advance and take your LIRR ticket with you when exiting the train, it will be collected at the gate at Mets Willets-Point Station.

LIRR Service for Foo Fighters Concert at Citi Field July 15 & 16

The LIRR is making extra stops to Mets-Willets Point Station to get fans to and from the Foo Fighters Concert at Citi Field on July 15 & 16. Fans traveling from Long Island on other LIRR branches can reach Citi Field by transferring to a Port Washington train at Woodside. Buy round-trip tickets in advance and take your LIRR ticket with you when exiting the train, it will be collected at the gate at Mets Willets-Point Station.

Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.

Metro-North Gets You to the Ticker-tape Parade for the U.S. Women's Soccer Team

Metro-North Gets You to the Ticker-tape Parade for the U.S. Womens Soccer Team! Take Metro-North to see the historic ticker-tape parade for the world champion U.S. Women's Soccer Team on Friday, July 10 in lower Manhattan. Select trains arriving in Grand Central from 8 AM-10 AM, and departing Grand Central from 2 PM-6 PM, will have additional cars to accommodate parade goers. We will be adding two extra Hudson/New Haven Line trains to Grand Central timed to get you to the start of the parade, and two extra trains to return you home after the parade is over. Easy subway connections to the parade route from Grand Central See full details at http://bit.ly/1HioUjB

Metro-North Gets You to the Ticker-tape Parade for the U.S. Women’s Soccer Team!

Take Metro-North to see the historic ticker-tape parade for the world champion U.S. Womens Soccer Team on Friday, July 10 in lower Manhattan. Select trains arriving in Grand Central from 8 AM-10 AM, and departing Grand Central from 2 PM-6 PM, will have additional cars to accommodate parade goers. We will be adding two extra Hudson/New Haven Line trains to Grand Central timed to get you to the start of the parade, and two extra trains to return you home after the parade is over. Easy subway connections to the parade route from Grand Central See full details at http://bit.ly/1HioUjB

Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.
LIRR Extra E/B Service for start of July 4th Holiday

The LIRR is operating additional eastbound trains from Penn between 1:40PM & 3:48PM today for those getting an early start on the July 4th holiday. There are four added trains on the Babylon Br., three added trains on the Port Jefferson Br., and one each on the Port Wash, Far Rockaway & Ronkonkoma branches. See current timetables or ww.mta.info.

Bicycle permits are required to bring bikes onboard LIRR trains, with the exception of folding bikes. Bike permits can be purchased for $5 at LIRR station ticket windows or onboard trains. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for details on bike restrictions.

New Haven Line Peak Delays due to Devon Bridge Mechanical Problems

New Haven Line customers traveling through the area of Stratford should anticipate rush hour delays until further notice because of train congestion resulting from mechanical problems with the Devon Movable Bridge. See full details at http://bit.ly/1dyjHt9 Metro-North anticipates train congestion during rush hours due to the use of only two of Devons four tracks. The Connecticut Department of Transportation has issued an emergency declaration that will enable contractors and Metro-North personnel to expedite repairs to the bridge.
